(Same as JS 205 1)
This course satisfies the Religion major requirement:- Tradition-Judaism.
This course focuses on the Hebrew Bible (in English translation), an anthology of texts also known as the Jewish Bible or Tanakh and as the Old Testament in Christianity. We will explore the literature of the Hebrew Bible as the work of ancient authors and editors addressed to their ancient audiences. We will also investigate how this literature has been interpreted and understood over centuries by Jews and Christians, with particular attention to Jewish traditions of interpretation (such as midrash). While the course will give significant attention to how various communities identify, interpret, and appeal to the Hebrew Bible as sacred and authoritative, no particular position of belief about the Hebrew Bible will be assumed or required for participation in the course, nor will any prior knowledge of the Hebrew Bible be expected. Students of all knowledge backgrounds will be welcomed in this course.
course_description: The Hebrew scriptures ("Old Testament"), in translation, examined in their historical setting, and in their roles as sacred texts in Judaism and Christianity.
